comments: I have taken several of Professor Jolly\'s classes online. I love her, she is so open minded and takes the time to read your papers and give great feedback. Her classes are enjoyable. Give you a outline of the class, with time to get your assignments in. I would recommend her to anyone! Great Teachers.

comments: This was my first on line class. Prof Jolly was helpful and fair in her grading. There were weekly required assignments and replies to other classmates that were not difficult or time consuming. The exams are difficult with questions you have to think about and timed but if you prepare with the exam study guide you will do well.

comments: I really enjoyed taking her PSY101 online course. I heard great things about her and she was very sweet and caring. However, the online course does require you to read the book and take notes instead of posting or listening to lectures which can make for difficult exams. Regardless, as long as you read the summary of each chapter you\'ll be fine!

comments: This is my second time taking Professor Jolly and she is just the best. Funny, kind and interesting. She absolutely knows her stuff too. Grading consists of opinion based papers, and tests. Just go over the notes and some textbook material and you should pass easily. 10/10 would definitely take her again.

comments: Shes a really good teacher! Shes younger and she explains things well. She ALWAYS mentions her family, but I think its a good way to understand things better. She has assignments posted on elearning that are all due throughout the course, so I just banged them all out within a month. Shes real nice

comments: Professor Jolly was a great Psych teacher. Her grading was laid out clear from day one so you knew exactly what you needed to do and get in order to pass. Most of her quizzes and tests are pulled right from the slides and I hardly used the book at all because of that. Participation in class discussions is very important to her so speak up in class!

comments: I took this class online and she was one of the nicest professors I had. She doesn\'t allow any late assignments or exceptions but she is clearly willing to do anything to help. Basically the class (Online) is set up one discussion post and assignment a week with the occasional test (50 multiple choice). Just put in effort and you will def get an A!

comments: Lots of reading and writing. 10 essays and 10 discussion posts, all easy. Prof gives very thoughtful feedback on assignments, grades could be given a little faster though. Tests would be absolutely impossible if they weren\'t open book. Even with the book, a 100 is tough to come by though. Put the work in and you\'ll get an A in this class.

comments: Professor Jolly is awesome. The discussion questions were interesting and she always gave great feedback. Everything was graded within the timeframe promised, the exams were passable if you take notes. Papers were based on articles and videos she provided, exams were textbook-based. I would love to take her class again.

comments: Professor Jolly\'s class was hard, but interesting. If you want an A, you have to work for it. The quizzes are on what is in her powerpoints and they\'re fairly easy. The tests were more out of the textbook, so make sure you have it. She does not offer any extra credit but does drop the lowest quiz and test grade. You can tell she knows her psych.

comments: If you want to learn every detail possible about her family sign up right now. If you actually want to learn psych pick someone else. There\'s 3 tests+final, 5 quizzes (which are difficult), and 7 online assignments which replace 7 classes. She drops lowest test, quiz, and 2 OAs. The final is picked randomly from 20 Qs, 10 of which are the final.

comments: I am a psychology major, and I have taken Jolly for all of my psych related classes, both in person, and online. I wish I was able to take more of her in-person classes because her lectures are awesome and very interesting!! She is super sweet, and really wants her students to succeed! I wish miss Professor Jolly when I leave RCGC, she\'s the best!

comments: I took PSY101 online. Professor Jolly was great. Even though the course was online, she was easily accessible by email. Expectations of the course were clearly outlined. All the Assignments and Discussion groups were open from the first day of class so you could work ahead. Exams were open for a week allowing plenty of time to complete. Great Prof!
